intro: Pellionia stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit pellionia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Pellionia stenocarpa is often grown as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its unique visual appeal.
